forms.Que (Object, Receives Action (COD, compl: Le livre que j’ai lu était intéressant.--The book that I read was interesting.
forms.Ce Que (Object, Receives Action (COD, co: Je ne comprends pas ce que tu dis.--I don't understand what you are saying.
forms.Qui (Subject, Who, What): L’homme qui parle est mon professeur.--The man who is speaking is my teacher.
forms.Ce Qui (Subject, does Action, What): Ce qui m’intéresse, c’est le français.--What interests me is French.
forms.à (to, at, in): Je vais à Paris.--I’m going to Paris.
forms.chez (at the home of): Je suis chez moi.--I’m at home.
forms.dans (in, inside): Le livre est dans le sac.--The book is in the bag.
forms.entre (between): Il est entre deux voitures.--He’s between two cars.
forms.sur (on): Le stylo est sur la table.--The pen is on the table.
forms.sous (under): Le chat est sous la chaise.--The cat is under the chair.
forms.devant (in front of): Il est devant la porte.--He’s in front of the door.
forms.derrière (behind): Le jardin est derrière la maison.--The garden is behind the house.
forms.près de (near, close to, far): L’école est près de la gare.--The school is near the station.
forms.loin de (far from): Elle habite loin de la ville.--She lives far from the city.
forms.au-dessus de (above, over): L’avion vole au-dessus de la mer.--The plane flies above the sea.
forms.au-dessous de (below, under): La cave est au-dessous de la maison.--The cellar is below the house.

forms.à (at (specific time)): Le train part à 8h.--The train leaves at 8.
forms.en (in (months, years, duration)): Il est né en juin.--He was born in June.
forms.depuis (since, for (duration)): J’habite ici depuis 2010.--I’ve lived here since 2010.
forms.pendant (during, for): Il a dormi pendant 2 heures.--He slept for 2 hours.
forms.avant (before): Je pars avant midi.--I’m leaving before noon.
forms.après (after): On se voit après le travail.--We’ll see each other after work.
forms.jusqu’à (until, up to): Il reste jusqu’à 18h.--He stays until 6 PM.

forms.à cause de (because of (negative)): Il est parti à cause de la pluie. → He left because of the rain.
forms.grâce à (thanks to (positive)): J’ai réussi grâce à toi. → I succeeded thanks to you.
forms.pour (for, in order to): C’est pour toi. → It’s for you.
forms.sans (without): Il est parti sans dire au revoir. → He left without saying goodbye.
forms.selon (according to): Selon lui, c’est vrai. → According to him, it’s true.
forms.avec (with): Je travaille avec elle. → I’m working with her.
forms.comme (like, as): Il travaille comme serveur. → He works as a waiter.
